question:
1. What is the maximum weight for a drone to be considered a small unmanned aircraft under Part 107?
A. 10 lbs
B. 55 lbs
C. 60 lbs
D. 100 lbs

2. What is the primary purpose of a remote pilot's preflight inspection?
A. To ensure that the drone is properly charged
B. To ensure the drone is safe for operation
C. To test the radio controller
D. To check the weather forecast

3. Under Part 107, how high can you fly a drone?
A. 100 feet
B. 200 feet
C. 400 feet
D. 1000 feet

4. Which of the following is not a requirement for a Remote Pilot Certificate?
A. Be at least 17 years old
B. Be a U.S. citizen
C. Pass an FAA-approved aeronautical knowledge test
D. Be able to read, speak, and understand English

5. When flying a drone in controlled airspace, what is required?
A. Authorization from the FAA
B. A special pilot's license
C. A transponder on the drone
D. A weather report

6. What is the maximum allowable blood alcohol concentration (BAC) for a remote pilot to operate a drone?
A. 0.00%
B. 0.04%
C. 0.08%
D. 0.10%

7. When is it permissible to fly a drone at night under Part 107?
A. Only with a special waiver
B. Always
C. Never
D. When the drone has a special night-vision camera

8. What is the main purpose of the Remote Pilot Certificate?
A. To demonstrate knowledge of drone operations
B. To qualify pilots for commercial flight
C. To ensure drone safety
D. To give permission to fly anywhere

9. If a drone pilot is unable to see the drone in the air, what must they do?
A. Continue flying
B. Use a second observer
C. Call the FAA
D. Land immediately

10. What is the meaning of 'line-of-sight' in drone operations?
A. The drone must always remain within 500 feet of the operator
B. The drone must be visible to the operator at all times
C. The operator must use binoculars
D. The operator must be able to hear the drone

11. Which of the following is prohibited under Part 107?
A. Flying in controlled airspace with approval
B. Flying over people
C. Flying with a remote control that is not within visual line-of-sight
D. Flying at night with special lighting

12. What is the maximum permissible altitude for a drone flying near a structure?
A. 400 feet above the structure
B. 200 feet above the structure
C. 400 feet above the ground level
D. 1000 feet above the structure

13. Which of the following is required to operate a drone commercially?
A. A Remote Pilot Certificate
B. A private pilot's license
C. A specific type of insurance
D. A commercial flight certification

14. What is the minimum age requirement to obtain a Remote Pilot Certificate?
A. 16 years old
B. 18 years old
C. 21 years old
D. 17 years old

15. Under Part 107, which of the following is a requirement for operating a drone in controlled airspace?
A. Approval from the FAA
B. Use of a transponder
C. A spotter with binoculars
D. Drone must weigh less than 10 lbs

16. Which of the following weather conditions would likely cause a delay or cancellation of a drone operation?
A. Clear skies with no clouds
B. Winds exceeding the maximum allowable limits
C. Light rain
D. A few scattered clouds

17. What is the definition of 'aeronautical decision-making'?
A. Choosing the best route to the destination
B. The process of evaluating the weather forecast
C. The ability to make safe decisions in drone operations
D. Choosing the correct drone model for the mission

18. What must a remote pilot do before each flight?
A. Check the weight of the drone
B. Perform a preflight inspection
C. Confirm the drone's GPS signal strength
D. Check the weather report only

19. In the event of an emergency during flight, what should the remote pilot do first?
A. Contact the nearest control tower
B. Attempt to land the drone safely
C. Call for help
D. Continue flying to the nearest airport

20. What does the term 'CTR' refer to in aviation?
A. Control Tower Radar
B. Controlled Airspace
C. Clear Traffic Route
D. Centerline Transmitter

21. Which of the following statements is true regarding weather conditions for flying a drone?
A. Drones can be flown in all weather conditions
B. Drones should never be flown in high winds
C. Drones can only be flown during daylight hours
D. Drones can be flown only in cloudy weather

22. What is the minimum distance a drone must maintain from people who are not directly participating in the operation?
A. 50 feet
B. 100 feet
C. 200 feet
D. 500 feet

23. Which of the following conditions must be met for a drone to operate in Class B airspace?
A. The drone must have an approved radar
B. The remote pilot must have prior approval
C. The drone must be able to climb faster than 200 feet per minute
D. The drone must have a GPS system

24. What does 'visual line-of-sight' (VLOS) mean for drone operations?
A. The operator must see the drone at all times during the flight
B. The drone must be equipped with a camera
C. The operator must only see the drone during takeoff
D. The operator must see the drone in flight through a monitor

25. What should a remote pilot do if a drone loses communication with the controller during flight?
A. Keep flying the drone
B. Immediately land the drone
C. Fly the drone until battery power is low
D. Contact the FAA

26. In the event of a drone accident, what must a remote pilot do?
A. File a flight plan
B. Report the incident to the FAA if required
C. Check the weather conditions
D. Check the drone's logbook

27. Which of the following is a requirement for flying a drone at night?
A. The drone must have external lighting visible for at least 3 miles
B. The pilot must have a special night certification
C. The drone must be equipped with a thermal camera
D. The drone must be flown at a maximum of 200 feet

28. Under Part 107, which of the following is a prohibited operation?
A. Flying over people without a waiver
B. Flying near airports with proper authorization
C. Flying in restricted airspace with a waiver
D. Flying below 400 feet in Class G airspace

29. How often must a remote pilot take a recurrent knowledge test to maintain their certification?
A. Every year
B. Every 2 years
C. Every 3 years
D. Every 5 years

30. What is the primary purpose of the preflight briefing?
A. To discuss the flight plan
B. To ensure the drone's camera is working
C. To check for traffic congestion
D. To review emergency procedures and roles
